Name: Minority Report
Review: The concept for this movie is interesting at first, but after watching I realized it’s just too ambitious. Also the “futuristic” setting felt extremely forced. Mediocre acting also didn’t help. Still not a bad watch due to the interesting plot.

Name: Get Out
Review: Best movie I’ve ever seen. From the deep plot to the fitting social critiques, it all just works together perfectly.

Name: The Matrix
Review: If an Alex Jones conspiracy theory was made into a full-length film

Name: Grown Ups
Review: I liked the part where Adam Sandler fingered his childhood friend in the ass

Name: Nightcrawler
Review: A few days after watching this, I still can’t tell if I hate Lou because I’m supposed to, or if I hate him because he reminds me of ben shapiro impersonators. I liked the concept of the movie, Lou and other characters left me feeling confused at the end

Name: Parasite
Review: Before watching, I had high expectations but at the same time I had a feeling I was going to be disappointed. Nothing about Parasite ended up being disappointing, it has almost everything you could want out of a great film

Name: Once Upon a Time… in Hollywood
Review: Besides an amazing atmosphere and an unexpected ending, there's not much that I enjoyed. Brad Pitt's performance was the only one that stuck out to me. I appreciate how subtle this film was compared to the rest of Tarantino's work, but it went too far with that for it's two and a half hour run time

Name: Us
Review: Somehow this movie incredibly manages to be so deep yet so straightforward at the same time. At the surface, it can be a typical horror plot of hunter/hunted, but deeper down it can tell a story of psychological trauma. Great performances, atmosphere, and foreshadowing coupled with the genius story make for an insanely good film

Name: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
Review: First superhero movie I’ve enjoyed in a long time. Also has an amazing art style so there’s not much more I could ask for

Name: Nuts for Pudding
Review: Beautiful character development. Camera work truly reminds me of Kubrick in his prime. Simply perfect cinema.

Name: American Psycho
Review: I still can’t tell if I love or hate the ending, but I have a feeling it’ll grow on me no matter what. One thing I can say for sure is that the performances alone were enough to keep me interested

Name: Believe It
Review: a brilliant, yet cautionary tale about the evils of capitalism.

Name: Free Guy
Review: The kind of movie that hurts to watch, meanwhile your parents are sitting next to you laughing the whole time. It's also incredibly ironic how the plot is about people who's indie game was ripped off by a big studio, but the entire movie is a cheap ripoff of the concept "what if we made GTA a movie????". Please don't punish yourself by watching this

Name: Baby Driver
Review: The first half felt super deliberate, I loved the attention to all the little details. The second half wasn't much different, but I couldn't pay attention to the little things because my heart was pounding and my hands were sweating. Keep in mind that I was laying in bed, just watching this on my phone. This movie did an incredible job of sucking me, it really made me care. Thank you reed for the recommendation :)

Name: No Time to Die
Review: I didn’t feel super invested in it, but that’s kinda my fault for not watching any of the prior daniel craig bond movies. A fine action movie overall, but I think I’ll appreciate it more if I watch the first four. Probably won’t do that since I watch roughly 1 film every 2 months, but let’s pretend I will

Name: American Beauty
Review: I hate to be like this but kevin spacey was just too damn creepy for this to be great

Name: Eternals
Review: really love the idea that hiroshima was caused by a seven thousand year old superhero and not the us military!

Name: The Shining
Review: Although a bit long and slow paced at times, I was still fully invested the entire time. The camera work, colors, lighting, sounds, all of the little things added together so well and it all felt so deliberate. Excited to watch some more Kubrick

Name: Die Hard
Review: Didn’t live up to all the hype, but the bar was probably set way too high. Still a lot of fun to watch and im glad i finally did.

Name: Princess Mononoke
Review: I now have an incredibly strong urge to play breath of the wild

Name: American Psycho
Review: I would like to know who was tasked with doing the drawings in Patrick’s planner. Just curious who was given that job

Name: The Truman Show
Review: Can’t believe they made Free Guy but with real stakes and intrigue! (im still mad at Free Guy but watching actual good movies helps the anger subside)

Name: Batman Begins
Review:
My brain has been beaten down by marvel so it was nice to see a superhero movie that wasn’t that same formula. That being said, it still struggled to balance Bale’s origin story with the Scarecrow narrative. 

At the very least, Batman Begins cleaned the bad taste that Tenet (my most recent Nolan film) left in my mouth.

Not bad in any way but really just not for me. The bleak war setting combined with the continuous shot concept really made it just feel dragging. Still not bad though just from the visuals and atmosphere

Name: Your Name.
Review: Always satisfying to see time travel concepts pulled off well! (yeah im still mad at you tenet)

Name: The Dark Knight
Review:
I watched this so much as a kid, but I just never fully understood it. I’m happy that all the fragments that stuck with me just fell into place this time around. 

Besides that, there isn’t much I can think to say that hasn’t been said over and over. Simply a Nolan masterclass.

Name: A Clockwork Orange
Review: Me and the lads having some adrenochrome titty milk before a night of some good ol in out in out and luddy van

Name: American Psycho
Review:
“There is an idea of a Patrick Bateman, some 
kind of abstraction, but there is no real me, only an entity, something illusory”

Going into my third rewatch with this in my head  made me understand the ending much better. I picked up on a lot of little details throughout as well, and the actions of Pat Bateman just felt more understandable, in a twisted sort of way. 

I could watch this over and over and still pick up on new little things every single time. Masterclass

Name: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
Review: sacha baron cohen is the definition of a volume shooter.

Name: Fargo
Review: An intriguing story with just enough stupid jokes to keep me interested

Name: Midsommar
Review: There’s so much going on here that it’s hard for me to get a grasp for it all. One thing I know for sure is that the visuals were impeccable. The sheer contrast of peaceful, wildflower fields and inexplicable gore is such a bold contrast but it works oddly well. Would love to watch again to pick up on some more plot details but I don’t think I can subject myself to that again.

Name: Hereditary
Review:
Unfortunately, this made me feel more disappointment than fear. I was fully invested in the slow build up and unwinding of the family, but the satanic cult reveal was underwhelming and confusing. I can appreciate the attempt at a carefully crafted story along opposed to an overload of cliche horror themes, but the focus on the plot sabotaged the "twist" of an ending while leaving me without any real fear. 

Hopefully it will all come together on a rewatch, but that won't be happening anytime soon.

Name: Prisoners
Review: always be suspicious of a mf named alex jones

Name: Raja Rani
Review: very good drunk acting throughout the whole film!

Name: Django Unchained
Review: A good concept that lives and dies by Tarantino’s touch. I fully get the dialogue driven nature of it, but I never felt attached to that aspect of the movie so it just felt dragging. Still a fun watch just due to the action

Name: Zodiac
Review: Shoutout to the zodiac killer. Just a guy who wanted to say cops are pigs. Is he wrong??

Name: GoodFellas
Review: At first I tried to enjoy this for the story being told, but I didn’t feel satisfied. Something just didn’t click. Then I looked at it simply as the portrait of a “wise guy” life. The good and the bad. The successes and the struggles. Looking at it like this made me appreciate it for just what it is.

Name: Tenet
Review:
I can’t believe I still think about Tenet when I only saw it once roughly a year and a half ago. Something about it i just can’t seem to escape. Maybe it’s just such a facade. A blockbuster that seems to have much more to it than what’s there. 

Thank you reed for (1) seeing this with me initially and (2) continuing to engage with this confusing concoction of a movie with me to this day. Hopefully in the future I won’t wait 540 days to review things

Name: The Social Network
Review: I never saw anything with andrew garfield, but i always thought he seemed overrated. This proved me completely wrong. The movie was solid overall, but his performance was the stand out of the entire film. Not much else to say besides that

Name: Fantastic Mr. Fox
Review: Beautifully stylistic while always maintaining the themes of individuality and belonging. I will be watching this many more times in the future

Name: This Is Where I Leave You
Review: my parents would fucking love this.

Name: The Batman
Review: This was the highest my expectations have been for a movie in quite some time, and I'm happy to say I was satisfied. While not perfect, it was still a good new take on the character and it did a solid job of finding its style. This feels like the most natural version of Batman: dark and stripped back aesthetic, detective style, and not too many toys. Still not sure how this compares to the Nolan trilogy overall (not sure that it even matters), but I do enjoy the style of Bruce Wayne and Batman in this film. My biggest complaint is that the start felt a bit too slow, but it is an almost 3 hour movie. Also, very disappointed about that “bat playlist” tweet not panning out into anything. They really had Bruce Wayne looking like Robert Smith, but there was none of the music to accompany it. Quite a letdown.

Name: Lady Bird
Review:
timothee chalamet: *finishes in 20 seconds* 
me: “he just like me fr”

This movie is a good reminder that writing, directing, and editing is not easy work lol. Also are there any Kevin Spacey roles that didn’t age terribly? A secret group of students that are doing favors for him? Really?

Name: Gone Girl
Review: All I could think about was how much the wife looks like Phoebe Bridgers. Other than that, yeah this was good

Name: The Kashmir Files
Review: started fine but just turned into obvious bjp propaganda, not good!

Name: Se7en
Review: should actually be called ei8ht because killing an unborn baby is murder!!

Name: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
Review: Very torn on this one. I can appreciate parts of Tarantino’s style but maybe this was too big of a dose. Just enough fun moments for me to look past the incredibly slow pace. Volume 2 will either make me appreciate this much more, or I will really not care about this
